intro: Madhuca hainanensis, commonly known as Hainan waxtree, is a species of flowering plant in the family Sapotaceae. It is native to southern China, particularly the Hainan Island, and is characterized by its glossy, dark green leaves and showy, fragrant flowers. The plant produces small, fleshy fruits that are an important food source for various wildlife species. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates, often growing in moist, well-drained soils within forested areas. Due to its ornamental value and ecological significance, it is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens and conservation programs.
